reviews.title: Will Stay Here Again, and Again!
reviews.text: Stayed here right after the New Year holiday en route to a business meeting in Phoenix. I was thrilled with the service, the room, and the location. Next to the Sedona Golf Resort (walkable distance), my two room suite had a fireplace, refrigerator, wet bar, dual bathroom sinks, small dining area and an ultra-comfortable bed. Although I was offered a red rock view, I chose the golf course view and it was fine, although you can't escape viewing the parking lot. The rooms were very quiet, the decor was tasteful, and the location was great. It is away from the bustle of downtown Sedona which means traffic noise is minimized. It is also close to the Oak Creek Country Club, AND there's a spa. A really nice place. I will stay here again with my family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a decent hotel -- generally meets what you would expect from a Hilton. The set-up of our room itself was excellent. We booked one of the junior suites with a red rock view. My only major complaint was that the walls must be paper-thin. I read that in someone else's review, and they were exactly on the mark. We got to know our neighbors far more intimately than we wished. For this reason alone, I would steer travelers elsewhere...probably to a hotel closer to town. The Hilton is several miles south of Sedona. While that doesn't seem far, it does get old driving back & forth. But if you are interested in playing golf, this is probably a good choice. If you are more interested in the town of Sedona and hiking, I would recommend staying in town or closer to it. Sedona was absolutely breathtaking! Definitely take the Pink Jeep Broken Arrow tour!
reviews.title: OK...Except for Paper-Thin Walls

likes.liked: — the views and the general layout of our room
likes.disliked: — walls are too thin -- we heard our neighbors all night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip to Arizona was primarily to see the Grand Canyon, but we decided that we wanted to see what Sedona was all about. On the day of our arrival, we had checked on another website to see if pets were allowed to stay at the hotel. I called the hotel directly and they confirmed what the website said, so we booked a two-night stay. It was a slow time of year, so same day availability was possible.
reviews.title: Sedona Hilton - Nice Property

likes.liked: — That they were willing to have us stay with our two dogs
likes.disliked: — The $9.95 daily charge for the internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Sedona was much nicer than we expected it to be. The staff was great, the room (which in our case was a one-bedroom suite) was very clean, and the hotel and grounds were well kept. The pool areas are a definite plus. On the downside, I really wish they would not charge for internet service. They do have free wi-fi, but it does not work in all of the rooms. In addition, this hotel is a somewhat longer drive from the main part of Sedona. However, this would not keep us from staying there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel ! Away from the madness of Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our overall experience in Sedona and at the Sedona Hilton was a positive one. We also appreciate that they were willing to have us stay with our two dogs.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton Sedona

likes.disliked: — rooms could do with a slight refurb

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Sedona from 9/13-9/16. My husband was there for a business trip and I was there for a break away from the kids.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a king suite and it was wonderful. There was plenty of room to move around and I thought it was set up great.(It was also nice to have a fireplace.) I read reviews of people complaining about noise but we didn't hear anything and the hotel was pretty full while we were there. The room was very clean (and I am very picky) and the staff was very friendly. They went above and beyond for my husband. When we arrived, we realized that his laptop screen was broken. He HAD to have info that was on his hard drive so we couldn't use their business center. He called down to see if they had a monitor he could use in our room, and they were more than happy to get it for him. They had to go to storage to get it for him, but they did it and acted more excited than my husband that they were able to accomadate(sp?) him.(It was great!!)
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Views of the red rocks and golf course

reviews.text: Since I was on my own most of the time we were there, I ordered room service quite a few times, and the food was very good.(A bit pricey, but good.)
reviews.title: Still like the Hilton

reviews.text: I went to the spa one day, and although the staff was very friendly, it was not the best spa I've ever been to.(The prices were
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — a little bit of a drive to town

reviews.title: "Love The Hilton"
reviews.text: pretty competitve however.) I was dissappointed in the sitting area that you are in between services. There were (what seemed to be) maintence men walking through as well as a lot of other workers just walking through. There I was sitting in my robe while all these people walked by...I felt like I was on display. I most likely wouldn't go back to the spa.
We enjoyed our accomadations, location, and staff. Definetly would stay here again. We were upgraded to a suite, working fireplace, clean, room service was fast, everything ws great.
reviews.title: Happily Surprised

reviews.text: The Hilton Sedona Resort & Spa is excellent. The friendliness of the staff is unmatched from the time of our arrival. I have stayed at Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton hotels in the past but I was extremely impressed w/ this property. The concierge at the hotel went out of her way to help us plan a great stay in Sedona. She was extremely helpful. Room service was lickity-split fast. Red Rock view from our suite was amazing. Beds were extremely comfortable. Only minor complaint is the walls seem to be a bit thin but not so horrible that I would not return to this property. We took our entire family there (9 total) and everybody was very happy. The pools were fantastic and great burgers by the pool. Best I have ever eaten anywhere. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone who wants to visit the Sedona area. We felt pampered in every way. Two thumbs up for this property!
reviews.title: Great spot! Gorgeous views!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am somewhat alarmed at the good reviews this property receives. I often use the reviews on "TripAdvisor" to refine my hotel selection and I am experienced at reading through misleading reviews but this hotel has far to many positive reviews for what it is.
reviews.title: Not a Luxury Hotel and not even a Hilton

reviews.text: Summary:
reviews.title: Excellent Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Poorly built building using cheap construction and fixtures
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - Great Spa

reviews.text: My wife and I booked our first vacation to Arizona and spent four days in Sedona at the Hilton resort. Our trip was built around a full day excursion to see the Grand Canyon, so we chose Sedona to be our base of operations for day trips, the canyon tour and other activities in the area. I investigated several Sedona properties and thought the Hilton had the best rate for a 1BR suite level room and booked a package that included daily breakfast and a booklet of discount vouchers for local restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay amongst the red rocks

reviews.text: We arrived on a friday, flying into Phoenix and driving two hours to the town of Sedona. We actually drove past the Hilton property because we were following the road signs that read that Sedona was five miles away. So, please note that the Hilton is actually not in the heart of the town, but out amongst the red rocks and overlooks that lead into Sedona. This was fine for us as we don't mind driving around and exploring, but if you want to be in the heart of the town and walk the local streets, the Hilton is not going to be an ideal location.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was smooth, but we did request a room change. The first room they gave us was facing the parking lot in the front of the hotel and we complained and were given a slightly larger room facing the pool area. The response was prompt, courteous and understanding. The room was a perfect size, nice furnishings, a kitchenette, comfortable bed and sofas and a nice balcony. My only complaints about the room would be that the a/c unit was loud and would drown out the television when on, the shower and tub could use an upgrade, and while the maid service was good, they never emptied the trashcan under the kitchenette's sink. On the morning we checked out there was a very full can of three days worth of leftovers, snack wrappers, bottles and cans, etc. ( We left the counter open for the maid to see after the second day, but still not emptied).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in an Incredible setting

reviews.text: The property itself seems sprawling, but actually had a small, intimate resort feel to it. There are two pools; the main one with two levels and a bar area. The second is on the other side of the property off the restaurant and called the "quiet pool", so children weren't allowed. We spent time at that pool more than the other. We ate breakfast there every morning ( very early because we were on east coast time ) and enjoyed the buffet options for starting our mornings. We had dinner there only one night and it may have been the worst meal and worst service I had in Sedona. They may have been short-staffed on a Sunday night (?), but the service was very slow, the waitress seemed confused about serving the white wine chilled ( at $11/glass ) and the food ( we both ordered a trout entree with sofrito rice ) was dry, poorly seasoned, and bland. We briefly considered dessert before deciding if the entree was that bad, the dessert was not going to be an improvement.
reviews.title: Nice property -- OK location -- Disappointing Restaraunt and Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, this Hilton was ideal for our needs. Though its a resort style property, we did not plan to sit around the hotel every day or do spa activities as we wanted to see the town and surrounding areas. It is a good 10-15 minutes away from the main drag of Sedona, but the drive from the Hilton into town is one of the most scenic drives you may ever experience. I would stay here again for the comfort of the environment, but the mediocrity of the restaurant is a caution flag if you like to cap off a long day of hiking and sightseeing with a good dinner meal.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you are a golfer or just relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I like to see and excpect from a Hilton. Great customer service, extremely comfortable beds, niceley landscaped, 3 great pools. The Hiton Resorts never disapoint me.
reviews.title: Peacefull Tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at the Hilton Sedona, beautiful hotel with a great staff! Loved the outdoor heated pool, spacious suites and comfy beds. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the 15 minute drive into downtown Sedona, everything else was fantastic. Be sure to check out the Italian restaurant just outside the hotel (can't remember the name, but they have a sister restaurant right in Sedona...ask anyone around, they'll know where you mean) it was fabulous!!
reviews.title: Hilton Quality, though a ways from Sedona

reviews.text: Impeccably clean. Beautiful rooms. Highly efficient housekeeping staff. Helpful front desk and bell staff. The restaurant has lovely food for breakfast and lunch (we did not eat there for dinner), and a friendly flexible staff. We had a little problem with some golf package issues and the front desk manager took care of it completely and to our total satisfaction. The scenery is stunning. The two pools were clean and towels are provided easily. The concierge staff was very available and knowledgeable. We'd go back definitely.
reviews.title: Highly recommend!

likes.disliked: — They could use a shuttle into town, but they also were helpful in getting cabs if you need them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Resort exceeded our expectations. Yes, it is just outside of the town of Sedona but we regarded that as a plus. Sedona is more touristy and we preferred the quieter red rock area around the hotel. Our king suite was amazing - new, high quality bed linens, lots of fluffy pillows, very clean carpets and tiling. Large bathroom countertop, a mini-fridge and eating area (that we used for breakfast) and gas fired fireplace. We could not ask for anything more. The staff was friendly and the value for the money was outstanding (we set the price). The hotel also offered us a full day spa package for $10. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: An Excellent Choice for Sedona Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Sedona 6-9 October. Overall the service was very good; We called early that day and our request for early check-in (12:30 instead of 4PM) was taken care of as well as our request to be away from ice machines, elevators and stairways. Service was very good.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton for one while in transit to New Mexico. I'm glad I chose to stay there. The room we were given was room with two queen beds, a fireplace, large closet, towTV's, a dining table and wet bar. There was a mountain view out back and the room was clean and large. Had breakfast on the garden terace, and an early departure. Would stay here again on our next visit.
reviews.title: Wonderful Room

reviews.text: I chose the Hilton based upon a number of factors. Number one was the name. I've stayed at Hilton's before and never been disappointed. Number 2 were the reviews from this site. And number 3, I considered that I was taking a solo vacation, wanted something a bit more luxurious, and definitely wanted something that wasn't in the heart of a tourist section. The Hilton Sedona fit the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: Perfect choice for relaxing vacation

reviews.text: I arrived a bit early and was told that my room wasn't ready. I asked if they had any early check ins available and they said no, but that they would have a room on the third floor (I was originally to be on the second) available in an hour if I wanted to wait. I said sure! I gave them my cell phone number and went to sit out back by the pool and have a drink. An hour later the call came, they had a room ready for me.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised. I had reserved a king suite with a view and this is what I got. Now, I will admit it did overlook the parking lot, but if you don't look straight down and look out instead, the view was magnificent. I had a beautiful red rock view that was especially nice as the sun was setting. I spent a few evening sitting on the small balcony sipping a drink and watching the sun move along the mountain.
reviews.title: Great for families
Loved it!
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very clean and the staff very accommodating. I was a bit concerned since I was there as a solo traveler but (and this is another reason I chose the Hilton) it's nothing they weren't familiar with. I had a couple of requests I asked of the desk staff and they handled them promptly.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: We just came back from a lovely stay in Sedona. We stayed at the Hilton for 2 nights. The hotel was very beautiful with great scenery. The king suite was very nice, but we were disappointed that it did not contain a refrigerator. There was a mini bar, but there was no room for us to store water in it. A refrigerator would be an additional charge. Also there isn't anything in the kitchenette. There was only a microwave and coffee maker. We had stayed in a Hilton suite in Las Vegas that included dishes, silverware, toaster...so we found this to disappointing. However, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large. Our balconey was very small. We spent some time in the lounge one evening. It was very nice and the bartender AJ was very entertaining. However the lounge closed at 10:30 pm. The pools are nice, but there was not enough shade at the Shadowrock pool. It would also have been nice if they had had a pool waitress for drinks. My husband golfed at the adjoining golf course and said it was one of the most scenic courses that he has ever played. We enjoyed the hotel, but if I were to go again I would stay closer to town. We ate at the Cowboy Grille in Sedona and loved it. The food was very good. We also took a jeep tour which was average. It was a bit overrated. We visited Slide Rock State Park and really enjoyed it there. We had a lot of fun playing in the creek. All in all it was a very good trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights. Our suite was great, the bed was comfortable. The Spa was excellent. The air conditioning was effective. It was a perfect place from which to organise day trips and activities. It is not in Sedona itself but that did not matter to us.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

reviews.text: My only complaint was the restaurant service. Saturday night - very slow - and my elk chops were burnt, though I wasn't charged for them. Sunday morning a 20 minute wait for breakfast, with plenty of vacant tables in evidence. I think they need to get themselves better organised in the kitchen.
reviews.title: Check road construction before booking

likes.disliked: — location to main interests - road construction

reviews.title: Very pleased with the Hilton
reviews.text: We visited Sedona during spring break and it was busy. The Hilton was not our first choice, but the other options were booked. The Hilton is clean, well run and generally good. For the price I expected more. Rooms and beds average for the price. Concierge non-existent, which is dissapointing for a location like Sedona. The front desk handed me a tourist map which was not overly helpful. The cashier in the hotel gift shop was very nice and very helpful. We found the people in Sedona to be wonderful and random people helped us find what we were looking for. Hotel restauarant is ok. Breakfast time was very busy, get there early if you are in a hurry. The individual staff were very nice and helpful. A waiter at breakfast gave us a great recommendation for an Itailian restaurant in front of the hotel (sorry forgot the name). Biggest concern was Hilton is south of the main attractions and the road into Sedona is under construction. They didn't work during the weekend so it wasn't a problem, but Monday traffic was backed up from Sedona to the hotel, which could add an hour plus driving time. Sedona is a must see, but consider other resorts that are in Sedona or on the northern side.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Sedona to celebrate our 25th anniversary so we wanted to splurge on nice accomodations and this definately fit the bill. The surroundings were gorgeous, the location in Oak Creek was nicer than Sedona in my personal opinion. Why would you want to stay right in the touristy area and be distracted from the beautiful views by all the signs and advertising? Usually a shopper, I was so taken by the stunning scenery I didn't even look in the shops! The construction wasn't bad compared to what we experience here in Toronto Ontario so we were pleased about that . One of the negatives is the huge numbers of flashing construction signs took away from the charm of the villiage. Back to the Hilton, we ate in the restaurant one night and had an excellent meal in comfortable quiet and relaxing surroundings on the patio beside the pool. The rooms were clean and comfortable - love the mattress and bed coverings as well as the Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries and the nice robes. We had a room right beside the lobby though and the night desk clerk was very noisy. I called her to ask her to keep it down a little and nothing changed as far as I could tell. The music was still loud and someone was opening and closing a heavy office door every 5 minutes. Regardless, I would stay there again and wish that we had more time to enjoy the hotel. We were up at 6 every morning and on the road exploring the area. I was amazed at how quiet the construction was. The vegetation there must absorb the sound alot. The pools were gorgeous although we had no time to use them. I had no trouble finding parking close to our room.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the last day we had in Arizona after visiting the Grand Canyon. It was really wonderful to stay in such a nice, clean place with such relaxing amenities as a balcony, 2 hot tubs and 3 pools, which we took advantage of. The room was very nice, decorated well, clean, updated, with a comfortable comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Sedona Hilton--great way to end a vacation

reviews.text: What really blew me away was dinner and breakfast. The food was incredible! Seared tuna, spinach with pecan salad, lobster w/ blue tortilla quesadilla. Breakfast was wonderful as well. The chefs really know how to cook and to present the food. We had a great time in the pools and jacuzzis and the food was great. This is the best Hilton I've ever stayed at. Also, Hilton really impresses me with the service when you are using Hilton points--they roll out the red carpet.
reviews.title: Peaceful oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to this Hilton over Easter, a very crowded time of year. This resort was a calm, very quiet and peaceful oasis. The hotel was full, but we did not have a long wait for anything. We had a relaxing time and loved the easy proximity to Bell Rock, although the rest of town is a drive. Our suite was a reasonable size – much bigger than the suites at other child friendly lodgings. We had plenty of space, and a nice view of the red rocks, plus a kitchen, table, and fireplace. There are a number of pretty places to sit and relax on the property. The food was excellent (if expensive), rooms very clean, the pool pretty and clean. We appreciated the lap pool in the Spa, which had mainly adults when we were there. The staff was helpful, particularly the concierge. She had many calls coming in at the same time and handled everyone quickly and efficiently. The bellman offered to carry our bags to the room. Check out was quick, which we appreciated because we went directly to Phoenix Airport, sad to say goodbye to another great trip to Sedona.
reviews.title: Going Down Hill Fast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at many Hilton Hotels and this one is on my DO NOT RETURN LIST. After staying here several times in the past and was pleased the first few times, it seems they do not care about loyalty at all. Asked for a quite room, what did they give my wife and me? A room with a view of the parking lot. Asked for the 3rd floor since I am a very light sleeper and was given a 2ed room floor with a family with children above me that did not know how to be quite or walk softly. I asked for a different room but was denied one, even though I am a diamond member, they said they are different from the Hilton chain and things are different here. Yep things are different they no longer will get my money at this hotel.
reviews.title: Sedona visit with my wonderful wife

reviews.text: Wonderful experience from the kind the room upgrade, the breakfast buffet, the spa-workout center which included a spectacular outdoor lap pool. View was wonderful from our balcony too. Very clean facility and wonderful staff!
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: The hotel room was huge and we requested a Rock view. Our porch was unfortunately small (to enjoy the great view) but the size of our room made up for it. There were three pools, one for families, one for adults and people seeking quiet and the Spa pool. Didn't get to see the spa pool but the others were nice. The kids pool was awesome and my girls didn't want to leave. The staff and management (including Housekeeping Manager) were nice and professional.
reviews.title: Room was great, location was too far from Sedona proper
Sufficient
reviews.text: Here were the drawbacks: The hallway way dirty with crumbs and not just in one spot. The location is very far from Sedona. The price was too high given its location.
We spent $300/night if I would suggest for that price to find a place in Sedona. The Marriott is in the center of it all and is more affordable. There are also many other really great places.
reviews.title: Beautiful town of Sedona!

reviews.text: My children and I just returned from a trip to the Grand Canyon. We stopped at the Hilton Spa and Resort. It was okay, but it is definitely not your typical H.S&R. The pools were closed and gross. The rooms were small and dark. I would recommend another resort when traveling to Sedona. Sandy
reviews.title: Mostly Good but not perfect

likes.disliked: — Small rooms, smoke smell at times, pool not as clean as they could be

reviews.text: The Hilton Sedona Resort and Spa was a very nice hotel. We stayed here for four nights, July 19-22, 2007. There were four of us, my husband and I and our two daughters, ages 11 and 12. The room was nice, beds were very comfortable. We had a sitting area w/a pull out sofa, a kitchenette w/a small refrigerator, microwave and a small sink. We had a small balcony that gave us a partial view of the red rocks. The service was good, the breakfast was nice. I think that was the only meal we ate at the hotel. The pools were pretty small, but the kids still enjoyed them. They look much larger on their website. We enjoyed the location... being a little further out from the downtown area (but not too far). Traffic seemed to get pretty bad on the weekend and getting into the downtown area took quite a while... but I'd rather be on the outskirts than in the midst of all of the commotion. We went hiking on Bell Rock one day, which was a little too hot for my taste... but I can't complain, it is Arizona in July! I highly recommend the Pink Jeep tour! That was quite an experience! Several friends had recommended it to us, and I think that was the highlight of my kids' trip! They do some amazing things on those jeeps! I don't recommend it for those who are prone to motion sickness though! My sister got sick as soon as we were done! I would stay here again if we/when we return to the beautiful town of Sedona!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, some disappointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here 18-21 May 2007. We booked a king suite through the hotel website. The purpose of our trip was to relax, sleep in, swim and be lazy. We were able to do all that during our time at this resort.
reviews.title: Good views, nice rooms but it's not in Sedona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: First off, the resort is outside the Sedona city limits, in the Village of Oak Creek. It's a 10-20 minute drive to Sedona, depending on road construction delays. If you want to be IN Sedona, find something with a Hwy 89 or 89A address.
reviews.title: Did we stay at the same hotel??

likes.disliked: — Not as secluded as I thought it would be

reviews.text: Room: We had a king suite. The room was clean, roomy with the extra foam pillow I requested when we booked. There's a microwave, coffeemaker and small fridge (you have to ask for a key, which we didn't). The suite had a separate living/dining area from the bedroom. The walls are a bit thin. I could hear the guy next door snoring late one night. Bed was comfortable enough and the drapes were thick enough to block out any light. Bathroom was small and had the same problem that all hotel bathrooms have - no hooks to hang your towels!
reviews.title: what a joke ! bad location, overpriced,outdated place.
Views minus the crowds
reviews.text: Restaurant: We ate the Grille at Shadowrock - twice for dinner, the Sunday buffet breakfast and on our last day ordered breakfast from the menu. Dinner entrees are a bit spendy. Don't order the Broiled Elk Chops. For $27, you get two very tiny chops. Not worth it! Dinner prices ranged from $15-$30. Sunday buffet was $15. The waitstaff are wonderful. Very professional and helpful. However, the person who greets and seats, especially during the Sunday buffet was very disorganized. There's also a wait if you want to be seated outside on the patio.

Pool: There are 2 pools at the resort - Shadowrock and Cascades - and one lap pool at the Hilton Spa. We used the lap pool quite a bit. All the pools didn't seem to be very busy or full while we were there. The spa is also where a very nice gym is located.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent four nights April 24-28 on a 25th anniversary trip. Found the hotel to be clean and very comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Great concierge staff to help plan activities, recommend restaurants, etc. They have great spa offerings, which we did not indulge in because we were too busy with all of the outdoor activities available in and around Sedona. All of the rooms are suites and very spacious. Our only complaint was that we would have liked a mattress that was firmer, we both woke up with achy backs in the morning, but we are accustomed to sleeping on a very firm mattress at home. Other people may find these mattresses to be very comfortable. The onsite restaurant had a limited menu, but very tasty and fresh food. The breakfast buffet was excellent. This hotel is about 15 minutes south of Sedona's downtown area (which locals call "uptown"). We enjoyed being away from the congestion in town so the location suited us. Our room had a lovely view of the Red Rocks and a small private balcony. There are three pools and two hot tubs. One pool is designated as the "quiet pool," and is on the opposite side of the building from the other two pools. There is a child friendly walk-in pool that is very shallow. Also, poolside dining and bar with a waitstaff to deliver your drinks/food. We would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Romantic Vacation
Another night on the road trip--3rd night
reviews.text: We got in late after a long day and then left fairly early the next so we really didn't get to enjoy our stay very much at such an anticipated location. The hotel was very nice and our suite was very nice as well. The only thing that wasn't everything we expected was around the jacuzzi that we didn't use. We were trying to watch a movie and I guess it was the water pipes from either above or below us, but the noise was terrible. I was worried that it would continue through the night but luckily it didn't and we got a good nights sleep. The continental breakfast was good and we were off again. We would like to go back and enjoy this hotel and area more than we got a chance to on this trip so we would definitely go back again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel & spa because it was a little outside of the main Sedona area, and had many amenities, the best of which for us on this anniversary trip was to be the heart-shaped in-room jacuzzi. The room turned out to be a suite, with inclusive breakfast, and it was 3 excellent night's sleep. The suite was large, with a kitchenette, a balcony, the jacuzzi, and bonus! A fireplace too. However, we don't recommend paying extra for the jacuzzi unless you are only one person, or are two tiny people. We're not overweight, but my husband's 6-foot frame barely fit it in the tub, and his knees never made it under water. And when the both of us tried to fit in, let's just say it was an uncomfortable fit. Not what we'd hoped for. But the views were great, the spa was good, and the food was good too. We highly recommend paying for the breakfast with the room. You get a voucher that's good for the buffet, or anything you'd like off the menu. We thought that was unheard of, and really nice of them if staying multiple days, then you have more choices than just what's on the buffet - although to be fair, it's a very large selection.
reviews.title: Excellent Location & Great Night's Stay

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Resort and Spa for 5 days-April 18-22. Had a wonderful one bedroom queen suite with an straight on view of the Red Rocks..It was wonderful! Facility was excellent. The restaraunt served good food and has a Sunday Buffet which wasn't overpriced. The female Concierge was outstanding and provided good tips for places to eat, and activities. Italian Restaraunt below the Hilton has outstanding food! Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Sedona Hilton-Wonderful!

reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel with friendly and great service. Spa-fitness center were nice and the food in the restaurant was excellent.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a beautiful area
Nicer place to stay in Sedona
reviews.text: We have been HiltonHhonors members for many years. We have stayed all over the US in many Hilton brand hotels from coast to coast. This one was beautiful with a full spa in the back. The room was a one bedroom suite with a king. The bedding was wonderful as I expect at a Hilton. The bedroom was very warm at night even with the a/c on. The location is on the southern end of Sedona and you will have to go through many roundabouts to get to anything. If you are a hiker this is a bit far from the hikes you will want to take. The view from our room was beautiful. It was a treat to stay there. We enjoyed the adult hot tub at night looking at the stars and meeting other interesting guests. Upon check in they will give you a very helpful map and if you ask they will give you coupons to The Hike House to get free Red Rock park passes. Hike House was the perfect place for us as they helped us find our perfect hikes, have great cookies and wonderful owners.

This place was incredibly beautiful, the staff was friendly and the facilities were always spotless! We were able to use the concierge (Betsy) to book ahead of our arrival as well as during our stay. She was so incredibly helpful and informative. She is an asset to this hotel!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort
Stay in Phoenix
reviews.text: We just returned from a 6 night vacation for spring break with our 3 children 14,11, and 6yrs. We spent first 5 wonderful nights at the awesome Marriott desert Ridge. Then we stayed the last night in Sedona at this Hilton. It is run down and overpriced. what a disappointment. Wish we would have stayed at the Marriott and just did a day trip to Sedona. Also felt the food Was below par and the location at the very south end made it long drives to get anywhere. All of the hotels in Sedona seem overpriced since us a bit of a tourist trap location. But I don't mind paying when it's worth it. But Sedona is beautiful.

I was debating between the Hilton vs the Hyatt. Brand loyalty limited my options. We picked the Hilton since by using HHonors points, it became price neutral vs the Hyatt. Normally, it would be more expensive. The hotel is not in the touristy part of Sedona. It is a 10-12 minute drive but the drive itself is worth it regardless of how many times you do it. Excellent scenic well paved road. Can bike it too if you want. The staff were very friendly. The room was a one bedroom king suite with a living room containing a pullout sofa which was surprisingly comfy for the kids. Two TVs and a small fridge. So for traveling with kids and needing a place to stay for a few nights, the space was very handy. Pretty much what you'd expect from a Hilton in terms of cleanliness and service. The buffet breakfast was great albeit expensive. We did not use the spa or the pool or tennis courts but they were available. Parking is free. Internet is not! They charge per device for wifi which I think is below standard esp for a $275/night room.
reviews.title: Highly recommended
Not deserving of a "Resort and Spa" title
reviews.text: Overall, I highly recommend the hotel for those visiting Sedona and for a one day trip to Grand Canyon.
